title: 'The All Blacks didn't choke, they were strangled' - How the New Zealand media reacted after Rugby World Cup disaster
text:
For the New Zealand Herald on Sunday, there was no front page. Simply a black background and five lines of modest text, less of a headline, more of a public service announcement.

The All Blacks are out of the Rugby World Cup. If you want to read more, go the sports section.

New Zealand's last defeat at a Rugby World Cup all the way back in 2007 was different. It left a prevailing sense of injustice over a missed forward pass by referee Wayne Barnes.

There were no excuses this time. New Zealand were humbled by England in Yokohama, the kind of result that leads to a wider assessment of the state of the All Blacks.

The media have reacted accordingly.
description: For the New Zealand Herald on Sunday, there was no front page.
